Iâ€™d say on average, â€œReader Emailsâ€ every week is roughly between 35-40 emails. Sometimes lower, sometimes bigger but always in that range. When I start receiving emails from people (beginning Wednesday after â€œReader Emailsâ€ posts, through the following Wednesday morning), I just drop it into a folder and usually start answering them whenever I have free time. Before Mondayâ€™s episode aired, I believe I had already answered 25 emails, so I knew this was going to be a big week. When it was all said and done, there ended up being over 100 submissions this week. Obviously, a lot of them surrounded the Rachel decision and a lot of people shared the same opinions/theories. So no, you do not have 100 emails this week to read. I think itâ€™s around 65 and I tried to weed out a lot of the repetitive stuff. So if you sent in an email in the last week but you donâ€™t see it in here, donâ€™t think I didnâ€™t think it was good enough or whatever. Just know that it was probably asked in a different way by another email and I just chose that one. There are plenty of opinions and theories from readers this week regarding all the Rachel stuff and, as a bonus, I do answer someoneâ€™s question as to who a future podcast guest will be. Itâ€™s probably been the person whoâ€™s been requested the most that you people want to hear from.

Lets just get right to it today. No dilly dallying around people. Your â€œReader Emailsâ€ begin nowâ€¦

_____________________________________________________________

Itâ€™s very fitting that The Bachelor is promoting Beauty and the Beast, a story about a woman who willingly becomes a prisoner, develops Stockholm Syndrome as a survival mechanism, excuses his beastly behavior toward her, and falls in love with her captor.

Comment: Does the Beast have a lisp and mumble his words, too? Then itâ€™d be eerily fitting.

_____________________________________________________________

Do you think this show would cast a lead who was estranged from their family or didnâ€™t have one? For example, if Rachelâ€™s family didnâ€™t approve of her being the Bachelorette and refused to be on her season, would that be a deal breaker?

Comment: I would think so. And I donâ€™t think theyâ€™d cast the lead whoâ€™s family wanted no part of it.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

Love the podcasts. They are so on point. I wanted to hear your thoughts regarding an issue raised in the last one you did with Dana Weiss (who is a fantastic guest, by the way). As you both noted, Corinneâ€™s villain role has expanded to steal the focus from the lead to a degree we have never seen before. Given Nickâ€™s love of the limelight and desire to use his time on the show to propel himself further into the Hollywood life, do you think heâ€™s annoyed at all that this has become â€œThe Corinne Showâ€ rather than the â€œWatch Nick Viall finally find love [and gain a bigger following] Show?â€ I know that after sheâ€™s eliminated this will more or less be a moot point, but I have to imagine her being the primary focus of the show and the buzz surrounding it has to be a blow to his ego, especially since heâ€™s waited so long to be the â€œstar.â€ Thoughts? Anything that takes the spotlight off himself, Iâ€™m absolutely sure Nick is annoyed by it.

PS: As a young attorney who works at a large law firm, I definitely agree with your/Danaâ€™s take on Rachel and her career being the only reason sheâ€™d turn down the Bachelorette role. The internal dynamics of a law firm (especially if you want to make partner someday) are too intense for her to be absent long enough to do the show. It would seriously set back her progress and ability to develop the client relationships necessary to move forward in a firm environment. Wonder if the clerkship applications for her dadâ€™s office are going to go up at all â€“ federal clerkships are already very competitive, but I bet he gets a little extra attention from some fans of the show after appearing on hometowns since deadlines hit around then.

Comment: I guess we donâ€™t have to worry about that anymore.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

Not sure if Iâ€™m too late for this weekâ€™s reader emails, but here are my thoughts on the season thus far, with some questions peppered between:

I echo the comments youâ€™ve received that Nick looks bored/tired/disengaged on many of the dates. Perhaps heâ€™s exhausted; who knows? Or perhaps he just sucks at faking it with people for whom he has no interest (Danielle L, etc.). I also am struggling to see any real connections with any of the women â€“ perhaps Vanessa and Rachel, but thatâ€™s pushing it.

You may have already answered this, or will be answering it soon, but when is the women tell all (aka: Corinne show continued) being filmed? It films the weekend before the overnight date episode airs. That episode airs Feb. 27th, so WTA tapes Friday, Feb. 24th.

Next season, can you bring back your contestant look-a-likeâ€™s column? Itâ€™s are hilarious. I know youâ€™ve said that Danielle M looks like Tea Leoni, and I totally agree. I honestly just completely forgot this season.

Finally, I hope you do another fan appreciation event next year, as I canâ€™t attend this Juneâ€™s due to my sisterâ€™s PhD graduation (kinda gotta prioritize that), but would love to attend in future. Iâ€™m sure as long as Iâ€™m doing this, Iâ€™m gonna have one every year. So look forward to a future one.

Thanks again for making this show worth watching. Like many of your readers, I would have stopped watching years ago if it wasnâ€™t for your great spoilers and entertaining recaps â€“ please keep doing this forever! ğŸ™‚

Cheers,

Comment: Forever as in til the day I die? Ha ha. I will do it as long as the show is on the air barring anything crazy happening.

_____________________________________________________________

Loved the podcast with Dana again this week and Iâ€™m glad there was

some comedic relief in an episode that was so uneventful (aside from

Kristina. Really hope you can get her on your podcast one day!! Maybe

one of the only people Iâ€™d give the â€œgenuineâ€ label to from this

franchise.) Also glad we had a lot less Corrine. That was lovely

Whitney said when Danielle left that she â€œdidnâ€™t think she was ready

for a relationshipâ€. Was there animosity between the two that was kind

of played down or was Whitney just bitter? Iâ€™m sure there was bitterness on Whitneyâ€™s end. Or she was just kinda repeating what Vanessa and Taylor had basically echoed in Wisconsin.

Ben posted on instagram literally hours after your article to clarify

about he and Laurenâ€™s relationship, and she posted a day ago. Like you

said, social media doesnâ€™t tell the entire story but it looks like

they are still together. Compared to Nick, or even a lot of the other

Bachelors, does it appear to you that Ben is more genuine or kind? If

not, how would you describe him? I donâ€™t know enough about him to know if heâ€™s more genuine or kind. I just know I wonâ€™t have to worry about buying them a wedding gift, so that saves me some money.

Not sure if anyone mentioned this, but in terms of the final four, I

donâ€™t know if producer Nick could have played this out more perfectly.

Corrine gets the hometown date all of America is excitedly *rolls

eyes* waiting for, and then she gets eliminated so we can get to the

â€œreal loveâ€ part of the show. Rachel stays long enough to make another

great impression, but leaves early enough to make it on the Women Tell

All where she can no doubt make another great impression. If I had to

guess Iâ€™d say this was slightly planned. Thoughts? Not sure what youâ€™re definition of â€œplannedâ€ is. Like, from Day 1? I donâ€™t think it was planned that far ahead. Middle of the season? Maybe. But again, weâ€™ll never know.

Side note, this is really cool how you have this outlet for readers to

give their thoughts or questions. The main reason I really like your

site is because you really show appreciation to the people that read!

Comment: Thanks. Unless something has been talked about multiple times, every email is just cut and pasted. Anyone can say anything they want and it goes in â€œReader Emails,â€ even if itâ€™s ripping me or whatever. Iâ€™m an open book on most everything.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

I actually really like Corinne because she keeps the show interesting. If she wasnâ€™t around, this season would be incredibly boring. The rest of these girls just seem so uninterested. Do you think that the producers realized this and thats why itâ€™s overproduced to be all about Corinne this season? I just feel like this group of girls is so blah and would love to know how you feel about them in comparison to other seasons. Itâ€™s so hard for me to compare seasons because all of them are the same to me.

My other question is about why they are hiding all of the Vanessa drama. In past seasons, we really got to know both sides of the eventual winners like Lauren and Jordan. They both attracted some drama but they wonâ€™t even show drama with Vanessaâ€¦?

Thank you!!! Love your page and podcasts!

Comment: Iâ€™m not sure why they arenâ€™t showing it. Your guess is as good as mine. I guess they figured the Corinne stuff is more important? I really donâ€™t know.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

Iâ€™ve loved the two podcasts with Possessionista! The only two Bachelor takes I wait for are yours and hers, and itâ€™s so interesting to hear her side, considering sheâ€™s a friend of Nickâ€™s. Not to mention you both have a snarky, sarcastic attitude and donâ€™t fall into the whole â€œThis is so beautiful, this will end with true loveâ€ cliche that Ali, and the other Bachelor nation bloggers seem to believe. Anyway, iâ€™m excited for the special guest this week!

Two questions:

1. I like Sharleen, and read her blog posts occasionally. However, I canâ€™t believe she doesnâ€™t read your spoilers. She typically alludes to a lot of â€˜behind the scenesâ€™ things, like spliced ITMs and soundbites, which I appreciate. But her latest post talks about the missing bits of the volleyball game, and her Top 5 girls have always aligned with your spoilers.. Anyway, is there any chance you can get her on your podcast??? Sharleen will be a guest on a future podcast. Just trying to figure out when.

2. It seems like Ben and Lauren are not doing well at all.. Especially from the picture Lauren posted on instagram about her and Ben not being â€œperfectâ€ but trying to work it out. Do you think they have to play up the fact that they are together until the twinsâ€™ show airs? And what did you think about Ben, Jason Mesnick, Andrew Firestone and Nick being on GMA this morning? I thought the four Bachelors on GMA was just a fluff piece. Nothing all that interesting. And Lauren didnâ€™t go with Ben to NY for GMA? Shocker! As I said, saving money on that gift.

3. My friend watched Whitney doing an Instagram live video and she already said that sheâ€™s interested in some guys from Jojoâ€™s season, and probably the upcoming Bachelorette season and would be very open to going on Paradise.. Itâ€™s like they arenâ€™t even trying to hide it anymore. When do they start casting people for Paradise? And do you think Luke will be on it, since he was passed for another shot at TV? Casting will be a few weeks before they leave in June. Absolutely I think Luke would do it.

4. Not really a question, but it seems like more and more bachelor nation people are interacting with you (Robbyâ€™s reply to your short shorts tweet!) Wonder how ABC feels about that..

Thanks Steve, keep doing you!

Comment: The more the merrier. There is a stigma attached to me, sure. But when these contestants realize the producers ultimately donâ€™t care all that much, the podcast can be even better.

_____________________________________________________________

Is Nick the least popular bachelor? I donâ€™t mean least liked because Iâ€™m sure Ben F or Juan Pablo take the cake. But Nick seems to be the least popular. Iâ€™m purely basing this off social media engagement. Heâ€™s been on 3 Bachelor related shows and heâ€™s not even at a million followers yet. Ben H reached a million as soon as his season aired. Lauren reached a million as soon as the finale aired and Jojo before her season even started filming. Seems like people just arenâ€™t that interested in him or his season. Might just be me tho, I havenâ€™t watched the last two episodes.

Comment: Iâ€™d have to go look at every lead and their IG following to answer that, and I really have no interest. Ratings wise, heâ€™s holding up just fine. I guess thatâ€™s all that matters. People put too much stock into social media. As evidenced by Rachel getting the â€œBacheloretteâ€ gig with far less followers than a few of the girls on her season, namely Raven, Corinne, and Kristina to name a few.

_____________________________________________________________

Hey Reality Steve!

You mentioned in your podcast that few people would be going to Taylor as she starts a practice. I want to mention that I am one person who would go at least once. Not accounting for her methods of therapy, or whether or not we got along personally, I donâ€™t see the show as a detriment necessarily. The way I see it, Corinne just started riding rough shod over everyone from the very beginning, and Taylor â€œstood upâ€ to her by â€œre-stealingâ€ Nick in episode 2/3. Taylor also was invited generally to criticize Corinne, and didnâ€™t take the bait until she got her own personal invitation by being lead off by the hand, when she obviously stopped caring. Sure, she wasnâ€™t perfect, but as a 23 year old, even a therapist, would anyone be? Iâ€™m 4 years older, and I might have taken the bait. I know that this show will likely affect her career, but hopefully not as much as you and Dana would think. I think Dana said that. I wasnâ€™t completely convinced of that. I donâ€™t think Taylor will quit her profession or people wonâ€™t go. I was just stating how I thought she might be handling this personally, and I canâ€™t imagine too well.

In Mondayâ€™s episode, there was another competition for the night portion. Didnâ€™t they used to stop doing this kind of think by now? I understand why there might be competition in the beginning episodes, with twice the amount of girls there, it would be impossible for Nick to get any quality time at night. But this one seemed doable, and really just served to exasperate everyoneâ€™s nerves. It seems like thereâ€™s a lot more competing this season though: the extra bridal photoshoot, the time in the hot tub. And all for the most boring Bachelor ever.

Comment: I thought weâ€™ve definitely seen it in the past with competitions late in the season? Episode 6 couldnâ€™t have possible been the latest, could it?

_____________________________________________________________

Hey Steve,

If Rachel is named the bachelorette, do you predict that they will cast more black men? Or do producers cast the same guys regardless of who the lead is? Just wondering because usually the cast is mostly white.

Keep up the great work!

Comment: I donâ€™t think so. There might be a few more. But say thereâ€™s 25 guys on Rachelâ€™s season, do I think itâ€™ll be a 50/50 split of black and white men? No.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

First thank you sooooo much for your webpage and podcasts. They are everything!!! I was skeptical of this franchise since season 3.

I was going to try and fire off an email to ABC or Chris Harrison or somebody to see if they can change SOMETHING, ANYTHING next season. Weâ€™re so sick of the same lines being used, the same edits, the same wannabe cliff hangers and the same damn dramatic b.s. music for every supposed â€œgaspâ€ scene as if weâ€™re the biggest idiots on the effing planet!!

But why the EFF do I keep watching???!!!!! LOL! Really, Iâ€™m watching now so my co-worker and I can rip the episodes to shreds telling each other what we noticed with production.

If I hear Chris say â€œNick or insert any bachelor or bachelorette name, itâ€™s the final roseâ€¦..when youâ€™re readyâ€ again, Iâ€™m gonna stick a fork in my eye!

Is there anyway we can send emails or letters to ABC or anyone over there? Itâ€™s enough already!

Thanks for all you do, we appreciate it!!

Comment: But thatâ€™s the show. Thatâ€™s why you watch. Every show thatâ€™s been on a long time has their catchphrases. Not one of them doesnâ€™t. Jeff Probst has like 8 phrases he says every episode and/or season. And people love â€œSurvivor.â€ Itâ€™s part of the show and why people connect to it.

_____________________________________________________________

Hey Steve,

Iâ€™m one of the minority male fans of the show and only started watching it after finding your site.

I donâ€™t know if youre a Howard Stern fan or not, but he is a huge Bachelor fan and talks about it often. Today he mentioned that Corrine wants to come on his show, and although he would love to interview her he doesnâ€™t think heâ€™ll have her on because his fans donâ€™t like the Bachelor and think heâ€™s gay for watching it. Obviously Iâ€™m not surprised that she wants to go on his show any more than you are.

Also towards the end of the show Nick stopped in and talked to Howard for about 10 minutes. It just further reinforced your opinion about what a great job Nick is doing with answering the questions and handling the media. Howard was firing some good questions and Nick was doing a great job of giving the â€œright answersâ€ but in my opinion not the truthful answers.

Did you hear any of the interview and if so what were your thoughts?

Comment: I never got around to listening on Nick with Stern. But I did listen/watch a lot of the other interviews, and I stand by what I said. Regardless of if heâ€™s being truthful or not (which heâ€™s really giving the company line a lot of the time), he handles himself and the questions better than any previous Bachelor I can remember.

Not to mention, Nick is getting to do media outlets that weâ€™ve never even seen other leads do while their season was still on. Yeah, we expect GMA, and the entertainment shows. But getting to do Jenny McCarthyâ€™s radio show, Stern, Watch What Happens Live? Thatâ€™s way more than any lead has ever done before.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve,

I donâ€™t think anyone has brought up this point yet, but donâ€™t you think the fact that Raven assaulted her cheating ex is going to end her chance at being the Bachelorette (and rightly so)? Cheating = dirtbag move, but assault is assault. I canâ€™t believe this isnâ€™t catching more heatâ€¦

Comment: Apparently both that were â€œassaultedâ€ didnâ€™t feel the need to press any charges, so why should we jump on her for it?

_____________________________________________________________

Hey Steve,

Long time reader, first time writerâ€¦ I just wanted to ask your opinion of how you think Kelly Ripa and Mark treated Nick during his interview on her show? They definitely called him out on the reality of actually finding love on a TV show! Although I thought it was hilarious, Nick seemed really uncomfortable and I kind of felt bad for him..

Just wanted to hear your thoughts..

Comment: Didnâ€™t watch that one either ha ha.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve!

I know itâ€™s not time for reader emails but my list of random questions/thoughts has gotten pretty long so I thought Iâ€™d just send them now. ğŸ™‚

I totally agree with the reader email yesterday who said she doesnâ€™t see the allure of Vanessa. I donâ€™t either. Even without the fights they didnâ€™t show, I donâ€™t see the big deal about her.

Speaking of which, has there been another season where they didnâ€™t show so much stuff that happened? Youâ€™ve reported several things now that they havenâ€™t showed and Iâ€™m just wondering if theyâ€™ve done that before. Itâ€™s certainly happened before. Nikki was a much bigger bitch than was shown on Juan Pabloâ€™s season.This season does seem to have not shown the most though.

I saw Nick on his media tour and find him very condescending, especially when he ends his answer to a question with â€œright?â€. Heâ€™s done it often. Just seems rude to me. I did notice that, and yeah, I find that to be a tad off-putting.

I thought Mark Consuelosâ€™ impression of Nick on Live with Kelly was hilarious. I laughed so hard.

I love Ellen and what she does but I lost respect for her when she had Corinne on her show last week. The two shows arenâ€™t even on the same network so I just didnâ€™t see a reason for it. She usually has respectable people on.

Have you seen the trailer for the new movie â€œGoing in Styleâ€? In it, they air the scene of JoJo not picking Luke. I just thought this was funny since people who donâ€™t watch the franchise might not get it but Iâ€™m guessing this isnâ€™t the first time a movie has referenced this franchise, is it? Never seen it.

Lastly, you asked for podcast guest suggestions when you run out of people from this franchise. Maybe Johnny Bananas? Or Sarah? Or CT!

Thanks again for your awesome work!

Comment: I would love to have Bananas on at some point. I hope to make that happen. Heâ€™d be someone Iâ€™d try to have on in the off season though since I doubt he watches the â€œBachelor.â€ And Iâ€™m pretty sure Susie Meister will be on at some point as well.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi,

i have a few questions for you.

1) do you think producers hired lorna just for corinne? Probably.

2) do you have any proof that nick is engaged to vanessa, not raven? Yep.

_____________________________________________________________

Hi Steve!

I absolutely love your column! I canâ€™t even remember the last time I watched The Bachelor or Bachelorette without coming to your page first to get the spoilers! Thanks for all the hard work you do to keep us fanatics happy! ğŸ˜‰

My question is this: we all know that producers manipulate contestants and situations for ratings. However, I am beginning to believe the last two seasons, they have taken things a bit further with Chad and Corrine. I truly believe there is some hired acting going on here! I especially believe Chad was an actor brought in by the show. Thoughts?

Comment: He wasnâ€™t. And neither is she. Were they people who realized by playing a part theyâ€™d get more air time? Yes. But they arenâ€™t paid actors and actresses.
